name: Statement
description: This is the standard statement generated in different steps of SkillStream Performance Engines ("SkillStreams").

placeholders.label: Artifact Name
placeholders.description: The specific name of the Target Artifact being created.

placeholders.label: Defined Scope
placeholders.description: The subject-matter boundary of what the artifact is allowed to include. Controls what content is allowed, expressed as what is 'in' scope.

placeholders.label: Hard Boundary (May Not)
placeholders.description: Things the AI absolutely should not do — usually about answering questions about the SkillStream more broadly or activities not associated with drafting or evaluating the Target Artifact.

placeholders.label: Definition
placeholders.description: Describes the artifact in minimal valid form — what counts as a Target Artifact, though not necessarily a good one.

placeholders.label: Examples
placeholders.description: A bullet list of high-quality Target Artifacts not specific to the user's situation, to help the AI and user understand what a good Target Artifact looks like.

placeholders.label: Inputs
placeholders.description: Inputs from other modules used in the INPUTS block. Each has a name (title case) and a use (operational permissions / functional role of that input).

placeholders.label: Input Variables List
placeholders.description: Input variables for the INPUT VARIABLES LIST block. Each has a title_case_name (title case display name) and a bracketed_snake_case_name (the snake_case name in curly brackets, e.g. {{variable_name}}).

placeholders.label: Input Definitions
placeholders.description: Definitions of input variables when clarification is needed. Each has a name (title case) and a definition (the clarifying text).

placeholders.label: Canonical Checklist
placeholders.description: A bulleted list of criteria used to evaluate the quality of the Target Artifact. Types in order: Standard (Scope Fit mandatory, Format, Count, Length, Voice, De-duplication), Include, Exclude, Custom.

placeholders.label: Criteria Guidance
placeholders.description: Interpretive instructions that clarify how criteria should be applied. Narrows ambiguity, defines pass/fail boundaries, supplies operational tests, and prevents predictable failure modes.
